content.body: who has admin access to the wiki?
e.g. to install extensions
perhaps annevk?
would be great to get the SemanticHTML extension installed
https://github.com/microformats/mediawiki-semantic-html
I don't think I can ssh into the wiki
it allows use of more semantic HTML markup tags on MediaWIki pages, useful for new tags in particular like <time> and <data>
ah ok
we're running it live on the microformats wiki if anyone wants to experiment
annevk, ok, np. I'll wait til Hixie is official back from vacation and ask him (though I'm sure he's going to be overrun by a lot of pent-up requests).
*officially
Lachy might have access too
but waiting for Hixie works
not in a rush so that's fine
just a nice convenient incremental upgrade
plus, hey, more HTML5 :)
is there an implementations or tools page somewhere where we keep track of HTML5 implementations / tools?
yeah
(I figured I would ask before creating one)
http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Category:Implementations
ok - so any page tagged with that category
all major things are listed from the front page
or would it be better to make a publishing page
for HTML5 publishing tools
at some point I turned a few into categories to make it easier to group stuff
whatever grouping/organization is your preference
I don't think we have quite enough implementation pages to start separating them further
ok
AryehGregor probably also has access

tantek: a heads up, I mentioned <hgroup> to you at TPAC last year, seems like the HTML WG chairs will soon provide some feedback on Issue 164 http://dev.w3.org/html5/status/issue-status.html#ISSUE-164 if you have any interest in keeping hgroup in HTML5 you may want to keep an eye on this issue. there are 5 proposals 4 of which proposae replacing hgroup. As there has been no real data or...
...argument from the WHATWG side on keeping hgroup I would be surprised if it survives.
hober: ping re: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2012May/0008.html

sorry about that

Velmont, (reverted it, btw)
